ground_truth: The front door opens and Phyllis steps out. She closes the door and looks in the direction of the tracks. She opens the back door of the car and leans in. She pulls the rug off the corpse (which is not visible) and stands looking into the car, unable to take her eyes off what she sees, while at the same time her hands mechanically begin to fold the rug. The running steps grow louder and Neff comes into the shot breathing hard. He reaches her. Neff points back towards the tracks. He reaches into the car and begins to drag out the body by the armpits. Phyllis coolly reaches past him and takes the hat off the dead man's head. She turns to go. Phyllis releases the hand brake and puts the car in reverse. Neff is again busy unwrapping the tape from his leg. The car moves. The car, with the headlights out, backs up, swings around and moves off along the dirt road the way it came. They are talking to each other. Their lips are seen moving but what they say is not heard. They stop talking. Phyllis stares straight ahead. The sedan drives into the shot and stops without pulling over to the curb. The car door opens. Neff starts to get out. Neff turns back to her. Phyllis bends towards him and puts her arms around him. Phyllis kisses him. In the kiss he is passive. Neff going up. Telephone bell box and the door bell. The cards are still in position. Neff's hand takes them out. Neff comes from the bedroom, wearing the light grey suit he wore before the murder, only without a tie. He buttons his jacket, looks around the room, and opens the corridor door. Fifteen or twenty cars are parked now. Charlie, the attendant has washed Neff's car and is now polishing the glass and metal work. Charlie sees him. He straightens up. He walks up the ramp towards the garage entrance. Neff comes out at the top of the ramp and starts to walk down the street, not too fast. Camera precedes him. He walks about ten or fifteen yards. At first his steps sound hard and distinct on the sidewalk and echo in the deserted street. But slowly, as he goes on, they fade into utter silence. He walks a few feet without sound, then becomes aware of the silence. He stops rigidly and looks back. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment, then turns toward the camera again. There is a look of horror on his face now. He walks on, camera ahead of him again. Still his steps make no sound.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The entrance portal opens and Phyllis strides out. She shuts the door and glances in the direction of the tracks. She opens the rear door of the automobile and leans in. She pulls the carpet off the cadaver (which is not visible) and stands gazing into the car, unable to divert her gaze from what she observes, while at the same time her hands automatically begin to fold the carpet. The running footfalls become louder and Neff enters the shot panting heavily. He approaches her. Neff gestures back towards the tracks. He reaches into the car and starts to haul out the corpse by the armpits. Phyllis dispassionately reaches past him and takes the hat off the deceased man's head. She turns to depart. Phyllis releases the parking brake and puts the car in reverse. Neff is again busy unwrapping the tape from his limb. The car moves. The vehicle, with the headlights off, backs up, swings around, and moves off along the dirt road the way it came. They are conversing with each other. Their lips are seen moving but what they articulate is not audible. They cease conversing. Phyllis gazes straight ahead. The sedan drives into the shot and halts without pulling over to the curb. The car door opens. Neff begins to exit. Neff turns back to her. Phyllis leans towards him and puts her arms around him. Phyllis kisses him. In the embrace, he is passive. Neff ascending. Telephone bell box and the doorbell. The cards are still in position. Neff's hand takes them out. Neff emerges from the bedroom, wearing the light gray suit he wore prior to the homicide, only without a tie. He buttons his coat, glances around the room, and opens the corridor door. Fifteen or twenty vehicles are parked now. Charlie, the attendant, has washed Neff's car and is now polishing the glass and metalwork. Charlie notices him. He straightens up. He walks up the ramp toward the garage entrance. Neff emerges at the top of the ramp and begins to walk down the street, not too swiftly. Camera precedes him. He walks about ten or fifteen yards. At first, his steps sound hard and distinct on the pavement and echo in the deserted street. But slowly, as he continues, they fade into utter silence. He walks a few feet without sound, then becomes aware of the silence. He stops rigidly and looks back. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment, then turns towards the camera again. There is a look of terror on his face now. He walks on, camera preceding him again. Still, his steps produce no sound.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The front door is opened and Phyllis is seen stepping out. The door is closed by her, and the tracks are looked at by her. The back door of the car is opened by her and she leans in. The rug is pulled off the corpse (which is not visible) by her, and she is seen standing and looking into the car, unable to take her eyes off what is seen by her, while at the same time the rug is mechanically folded by her hands. The running steps grow louder, and Neff is seen coming into the shot, breathing hard. He reaches her. Back towards the tracks are pointed by Neff. The body is reached into the car for by him and he begins dragging it out by the armpits. Phyllis coolly reaches past him and takes the hat off the dead man's head. She turns to go. The hand brake is released by Phyllis and the car is put in reverse by her. Neff, again, is busy unwrapping the tape from his leg. The car is moved. The car, with the headlights out, is backed up, swung around, and moved off along the dirt road the way it came. They talk to each other. Their lips are seen moving, but their words are not heard. They stop talking. Straight ahead is stared at by Phyllis. The sedan is driven into the shot and is stopped without pulling over to the curb. The car door is opened. Neff starts to get out. He turns back to her. Phyllis bends towards him and puts her arms around him. She kisses him. In the kiss, he acts passively. Neff goes up. The telephone bell box and the doorbell ring. The cards are still in position. They are taken out by Neff's hand. Neff comes from the bedroom, wearing the light grey suit that was worn by him before the murder, only without a tie. His jacket is buttoned by him, and the room is looked around by him, and the corridor door is opened. Fifteen or twenty cars have been parked now. Charlie, the attendant, has washed Neff's car and is now polishing the glass and metal work. Charlie sees him. He straightens up. The ramp is walked up by him towards the garage entrance. Neff comes out at the top of the ramp and starts to walk down the street, not too fast. Camera precedes him. He walks about ten or fifteen yards. At first, his steps are heard sounding hard and distinct on the sidewalk, and they echo in the deserted street. But slowly, as he goes on, the sound fades into utter silence. A few feet are walked without sound, and then the silence is noticed by him. He stops rigidly and looks back. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment, then turns toward the camera again. There is a look of horror on his face now. He walks on, camera ahead of him again. Still, his steps make no sound.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The front door opens and Phyllis steps out, glancing toward the tracks. She opens the car's back door, leans in, pulls the rug off the unseen corpse, and stares, transfixed. Her hands mechanically fold the rug. Running footsteps grow louder—Neff arrives, breathing hard. He gestures toward the tracks, then pulls the body out by the armpits. Phyllis calmly reaches past him, removes the hat from the corpse, and turns to leave. She releases the hand brake, shifts to reverse. Neff unwraps tape from his leg as the car, headlights off, backs up, turns, and drives off along the dirt road. They talk, but their words are unheard. They stop speaking; Phyllis stares ahead. The sedan appears and stops without pulling over. Neff begins to exit, turns back. Phyllis leans over, embraces him, and kisses him—he remains passive. Neff ascends. The telephone and doorbell ring. Cards remain in place until Neff removes them. He emerges from the bedroom in his light grey suit, no tie, buttons his jacket, surveys the room, and exits into the corridor. Fifteen to twenty cars are now parked. Charlie, the attendant, has washed and is polishing Neff’s car. Seeing Neff, Charlie straightens. Neff walks up the ramp and down the street at a steady pace. The camera leads him. His footsteps echo on the deserted sidewalk, then gradually fade to silence. Realizing the quiet, he stops rigidly and looks back. The camera halts. After a pause, he turns toward it, horrified. He continues walking, footsteps still silent.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The front door opens and Phyllis steps out, closing it and looking toward the tracks. She opens the car’s back door, pulls a rug off the unseen corpse, staring fixedly while mechanically folding the rug. Running footsteps grow louder; Neff arrives breathless, points toward the tracks, then drags the body out by the armpits. Phyllis coolly removes the dead man's hat, releases the hand brake, shifts to reverse, and drives away with headlights off, following the dirt road they arrived on. They speak inaudibly, then fall silent. Phyllis stares ahead as the sedan stops without parking. Neff starts exiting; Phyllis embraces and kisses him passively. Neff ascends; the phone and doorbell ring. Cards remain positioned until Neff takes them, emerges from the bedroom wearing his grey pre-murder suit without a tie, buttons it, surveys the room, and opens the corridor door. Outside, fifteen to twenty cars are parked; Charlie, the attendant, polishes Neff’s washed car. Charlie notices him, stands upright, and walks toward the garage ramp. Neff exits atop the ramp, walks slowly down the street, camera ahead. Initially distinct, his footsteps gradually fade into silence. He stops abruptly, noticing the silence, and looks back in horror before continuing forward soundlessly, camera leading.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The front door swings open, and Phyllis steps out into the open air. She carefully closes the door behind her and turns her gaze in the direction of the tracks. With a deliberate motion, she opens the back door of the car and leans inside. She pulls the rug away from the corpse, which remains hidden from view, and stands there, transfixed, unable to tear her eyes away from the sight before her. Simultaneously, her hands, almost of their own accord, begin to fold the rug with mechanical precision. The sound of running footsteps grows increasingly louder, and Neff enters the scene, breathing heavily. He reaches her side. Neff gestures back towards the tracks with urgency. He reaches into the car and starts to drag the body out by the armpits. Phyllis, with a cool demeanor, reaches past him and removes the hat from the dead man's head. She turns to leave. Phyllis releases the hand brake and shifts the car into reverse. Neff is once again preoccupied, unwrapping the tape from his leg. The car begins to move. With its headlights turned off, the car backs up, swings around, and proceeds along the dirt road, retracing its path. They engage in conversation, their lips moving, but their words remain unheard. They cease talking. Phyllis stares straight ahead, her expression unreadable. The sedan drives into the frame and comes to a stop without pulling over to the curb. The car door swings open. Neff starts to exit. He pauses and turns back to her. Phyllis leans towards him, wrapping her arms around him. She kisses him, and in the embrace, he remains passive. Neff ascends. The telephone bell box and the doorbell are present. The cards remain in their original position. Neff's hand retrieves them. Neff emerges from the bedroom, dressed in the light grey suit he wore prior to the murder, now without a tie. He buttons his jacket, surveys the room, and opens the corridor door. Fifteen or twenty cars are now parked. Charlie, the attendant, has washed Neff's car and is currently polishing the glass and metal surfaces. Charlie notices him. He straightens up. He walks up the ramp towards the garage entrance. Neff emerges at the top of the ramp and begins to walk down the street at a measured pace. The camera precedes him. He walks approximately ten or fifteen yards. Initially, his footsteps sound hard and distinct on the sidewalk, echoing in the deserted street. Gradually, as he continues, they fade into complete silence. He walks a few more feet without any sound, then becomes acutely aware of the silence. He stops abruptly and looks back. The camera halts with him. He stands motionless for a moment, then turns back towards the camera. A look of horror now spreads across his face. He continues walking, the camera moving ahead of him once more. Still, his steps remain eerily silent.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The front door swings open with a creak, and Phyllis gracefully steps out into the fresh, open air. With deliberate care, she closes the door behind her and shifts her gaze intently in the direction of the tracks. In a measured and deliberate motion, she opens the back door of the car and leans inside with purpose. She gingerly pulls the rug away, revealing the corpse, yet it remains obscured from view. Standing transfixed, Phyllis is unable to tear her eyes away from the unsettling sight before her. Meanwhile, almost as if moving on their own accord, her hands begin to fold the rug with a mechanical precision that seems almost robotic. 

The sound of rapidly approaching footsteps grows increasingly louder, filling the air with urgency, as Neff enters the scene, visibly breathing heavily from exertion. He quickly makes his way to her side. With urgency, Neff gestures back towards the tracks. He reaches into the car, and with deliberate effort, he starts to drag the body out by the armpits. Displaying a cool demeanor, Phyllis reaches past him unflinchingly and removes the hat from the dead man's head. She turns decisively, preparing to leave. Phyllis then releases the hand brake and shifts the car into reverse gear. Neff, now preoccupied once again, busies himself by unwrapping the tape from his leg. Slowly, the car begins to move. Its headlights remain off as the car carefully reverses, swings around, and proceeds along the dirt road, retracing its path with a silent determination. Although they engage in conversation, their lips moving with intention, their words remain entirely unheard, lost to the night. They eventually cease talking altogether. Phyllis stares intently straight ahead, her expression unreadable, a mask of emotionless calm.

The sedan drives into the frame and comes to a complete stop without pulling over to the curb. With a quiet creak, the car door swings open. Neff begins to exit but pauses momentarily, turning back towards her. Phyllis leans towards him, wrapping her arms around him in a familiar embrace. She kisses him, and despite the closeness, he remains passive in the moment. Neff ascends. The telephone bell box and the doorbell remain present, untouched. The cards are still in their original position. Neff's hand reaches out, retrieving them with a measured motion. Emerging from the bedroom, Neff is dressed in the light grey suit he wore prior to the murder, only now he is without a tie. He methodically buttons his jacket, takes a moment to survey the room, and opens the corridor door with a sense of determination. 

Outside, fifteen or twenty cars are now parked. Charlie, the attentive attendant, has diligently washed Neff's car and is now meticulously polishing the glass and metal surfaces. Charlie notices Neff and straightens up. Neff walks up the ramp towards the garage entrance with a purposeful stride. Emerging at the top of the ramp, Neff begins to walk down the street with a measured pace. The camera precedes him, capturing his every step. He walks approximately ten or fifteen yards. Initially, the sound of his footsteps is hard and distinct, echoing sharply in the deserted street. Gradually, as he continues to walk, the sound fades into complete silence. He walks a few more feet without any sound, and then, with sudden awareness, he becomes acutely conscious of the silence surrounding him. He stops abruptly and looks back, his eyes searching. The camera halts with him, capturing his stillness. He stands motionless for a fleeting moment, then turns back towards the camera. A look of horror now slowly spreads across his face. He continues walking, the camera moving ahead of him once more. Yet, his steps remain eerily silent, as if swallowed by the night.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the front door swings open, Phyllis steps out into the open air, taking a moment to close the door behind her with a firm click. She pauses, her gaze fixed in the direction of the tracks, as if contemplating her next move. With a determined stride, she approaches the car, opens the back door, and leans in, her body partially disappearing into the vehicle's interior. Her hands reach for the rug, and with a swift motion, she pulls it off the corpse hidden beneath, though the body remains out of sight. Standing there, she is transfixed by the sight before her, unable to tear her eyes away, even as her hands, almost of their own accord, begin the mechanical task of folding the rug. The sound of running steps grows louder, and Neff bursts into the scene, his breath coming in hard gasps. He reaches her side, urgency in his movements, and gestures back towards the tracks, indicating the need for haste. Without hesitation, he reaches into the car, his hands finding purchase under the corpse's armpits, and begins the laborious task of dragging the body out. Phyllis, maintaining her composure, reaches past him with a steady hand to retrieve the hat from the dead man's head, a small but significant action. She turns away, her mind already on the next step, and releases the hand brake, shifting the car into reverse. Meanwhile, Neff is preoccupied with unwrapping the tape from his leg, his fingers working quickly. The car, its headlights extinguished, begins to move, backing up smoothly, swinging around with precision, and setting off along the dirt road from which it came. As they drive, their lips move in silent conversation, the words lost to the night, until they fall into a shared silence. Phyllis stares straight ahead, her focus unbroken. The sedan glides into the shot, coming to a halt without bothering to pull over to the curb. The car door opens, and Neff begins to exit, but pauses, turning back to her. Phyllis leans towards him, her arms encircling him in an embrace, and she kisses him, a gesture filled with complexity, while he remains passive in the moment. Neff then moves upward, the sound of a telephone bell box and doorbell ringing faintly in the background. The cards remain in their place until Neff's hand reaches out to remove them. Emerging from the bedroom, Neff is now dressed in the light grey suit he wore before the murder, though he has foregone a tie. He buttons his jacket with a practiced motion, takes a final look around the room, and opens the corridor door, stepping out into the world beyond. Outside, fifteen or twenty cars are now parked, and Charlie, the attendant, is diligently washing Neff's car, polishing the glass and metal work to a shine. Charlie notices Neff, straightening up as he approaches. Neff walks up the ramp towards the garage entrance, his pace measured. As he reaches the top of the ramp, he exits and begins to walk down the street, his steps deliberate but not hurried. The camera moves ahead of him, capturing his progress as he covers ten or fifteen yards. Initially, his footsteps echo loudly on the sidewalk, the sound distinct in the deserted street, but gradually, as he continues, the noise fades into complete silence. He walks a few more feet, the absence of sound becoming apparent, prompting him to stop abruptly and look back, his body rigid with tension. The camera halts with him, capturing the moment of realization. He stands there, frozen, before turning back towards the camera, his face now etched with horror. He resumes walking, the camera preceding him once more, yet his steps remain eerily silent, the quiet enveloping him as he moves forward.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Phyllis exits the house, closes the door, and glances toward the tracks before opening the car's back door. She uncovers the corpse with a rug and, while fixated on the sight, mechanically folds the rug. As Neff arrives, breathless, he gestures toward the tracks and begins dragging the body out of the car. Phyllis calmly removes the hat from the dead man's head, releases the hand brake, and reverses the car with the headlights off, driving back along the dirt road. They converse silently, with Phyllis staring ahead. The sedan stops without pulling over, and as Neff starts to exit, Phyllis embraces and kisses him, with Neff remaining passive. Neff then moves to the telephone area, retrieves some cards, and emerges from the bedroom in a light grey suit, sans tie. After buttoning his jacket and surveying the room, he exits through the corridor door. Outside, Charlie, the attendant, finishes polishing Neff's car. Neff walks up the ramp, and as he proceeds down the street, his footsteps initially echo but gradually fade into silence. Realizing the quiet, he stops and looks back in horror before continuing, with the camera capturing his silent steps.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The front door opens and Phyllis, a woman known in her community for her enigmatic and calm demeanor, steps out. She closes the door and looks in the direction of the tracks, the local train line that has been a silent witness to many untold stories. She opens the back door of the car, a vintage sedan from the 1930s with worn-out upholstery, and leans in. She pulls the rug off the corpse, which is not visible but crucial to their grim plan, and stands looking into the car, unable to take her eyes off what she sees, while at the same time her hands mechanically begin to fold the rug, an antique piece woven with intricate patterns. The running steps grow louder and Neff, her accomplice, comes into the shot breathing hard. He reaches her. Neff, a sharp insurance salesman entangled in a web of deceit, points back towards the tracks. He reaches into the car and begins to drag out the body by the armpits, employing a practiced method from his days in the military. Phyllis coolly reaches past him and takes the hat off the dead man's head, a gesture that indicates the removal of any lingering trace of their victim's identity. She turns to go. Phyllis releases the hand brake and puts the car in reverse, executing the maneuver with the precision of someone who has done it countless times before. Neff is again busy unwrapping the tape from his leg, an improvised silencer used earlier as part of their elaborate scheme. The car moves. The car, with the headlights out to avoid detection on the deserted stretch, backs up, swings around, and moves off along the dirt road the way it came. They are talking to each other in hushed tones characteristic of conspirators, their lips are seen moving but what they say is not heard. They stop talking. Phyllis stares straight ahead, her expression inscrutable as always. The sedan drives into the shot and stops without pulling over to the curb on the quiet suburban street. The car door opens. Neff starts to get out. Neff turns back to her, momentarily hesitating as if reconsidering the steps they've taken. Phyllis bends towards him and puts her arms around him. Phyllis kisses him, a calculated action to either reassure or manipulate. In the kiss, he is passive, seized by a mix of emotions. Neff going up. The telephone bell box and the doorbell, items often ignored, now seem ominously significant. The cards are still in position, part of the elaborate setup they arranged earlier. Neff's hand takes them out, removing the last traces of their presence. Neff comes from the bedroom, wearing the light grey suit he wore before the murder, only without a tie, marking his transformation from a man caught in the mundane to one embroiled in crime. He buttons his jacket, looks around the room, filled with memories and decisions that cannot be undone, and opens the corridor door. Fifteen or twenty cars are parked now, the usual sign of a busy street turned quiet after dark. Charlie, the attendant recognized for his meticulous care of vehicles, has washed Neff's car and is now polishing the glass and metal work, ensuring it looks untouched by the previous night's events. Charlie sees him, unaware of the secrets hidden beneath the polished exterior. He straightens up. He walks up the ramp towards the garage entrance, a transition from the known chaos to the anonymity of city life. Neff comes out at the top of the ramp and starts to walk down the street, not too fast, blending into the city's rhythm. Camera precedes him. He walks about ten or fifteen yards, with each step echoing his internal struggle. At first, his steps sound hard and distinct on the sidewalk and echo in the deserted street, a haunting symphony of guilt and fear. But slowly, as he goes on, they fade into utter silence, reflecting his descent into isolation. He walks a few feet without sound, then becomes aware of the silence, a metaphor for the void left by their actions. He stops rigidly and looks back, as if expecting to see the ghosts of his decisions. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment, then turns toward the camera again. There is a look of horror on his face now, realizing the extent of his moral downfall. He walks on, camera ahead of him again. Still, his steps make no sound, symbolizing the irreversible path he now treads.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The front door opens and Phyllis steps out. She closes the door and looks in the direction of the tracks. She opens the back door of the car and leans in. She pulls the rug off the corpse which is not visible and stands looking into the car unable to take her eyes off what she sees while at the same time her hands mechanically begin to fold the rug. Phyllis kisses him. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the kiss he is passive. Neff going up. Telephone bell box and the door bell. The cards are still in position. Neff's hand takes them out. Neff comes from the bedroom wearing the light grey suit he wore before the murder only without a tie. He buttons his jacket looks around the room and opens the corridor door. Fifteen or twenty cars are parked now. Charlie the attendant has washed Neff's car and is now polishing the glass and metal work. Charlie sees him. He straightens up. He walks up the ramp towards the garage entrance. Neff comes out at the top of the ramp and starts to walk down the street not too fast. Camera precedes him. He walks about ten or fifteen yards. At first his steps sound hard and distinct on the sidewalk and echo in the deserted street. But slowly as he goes on they fade into utter silence. He walks a few feet without sound then becomes aware of the silence. He stops rigidly and looks back. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment then turns toward the camera again. There is a look of horror on his face now. He walks on camera ahead of him again. Still his steps make no sound.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. In the kiss he is passive. Neff going up. Telephone bell box and the door bell. The cards are still in position. Neff's hand takes them out. Neff comes from the bedroom wearing the light grey suit he wore before the murder only without a tie. He buttons his jacket looks around the room and opens the corridor door. Fifteen or twenty cars are parked now. Charlie the attendant has washed Neff's car and is now polishing the glass and metal work. Charlie sees him. He straightens up. He walks up the ramp towards the garage entrance. Neff comes out at the top of the ramp and starts to walk down the street not too fast. Camera precedes him. He walks about ten or fifteen yards. At first his steps sound hard and distinct on the sidewalk and echo in the deserted street. But slowly as he goes on they fade into utter silence. He walks a few feet without sound then becomes aware of the silence. He stops rigidly and looks back. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment then turns toward the camera again. There is a look of horror on his face now. He walks on camera ahead of him again. Still his steps make no sound.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The front door opens and Phyllis steps out. She closes the door and looks in the direction of the tracks. She opens the back door of the car and leans in. She pulls the rug off the corpse which is not visible and stands looking into the car unable to take her eyes off what she sees while at the same time her hands mechanically begin to fold the rug. The running steps grow louder and Neff comes into the shot breathing hard. He reaches her. Neff points back towards the tracks. He reaches into the car and begins to drag out the body by the armpits. Phyllis coolly reaches past him and takes the hat off the dead man's head. She turns to go. Phyllis releases the hand brake and puts the car in reverse. Neff is again busy unwrapping the tape from his leg. Neff comes out at the top of the ramp and starts to walk down the street not too fast. Camera precedes him. He walks about ten or fifteen yards. At first his steps sound hard and distinct on the sidewalk and echo in the deserted street. But slowly as he goes on they fade into utter silence. He walks a few feet without sound then becomes aware of the silence. He stops rigidly and looks back. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment then turns toward the camera again. There is a look of horror on his face now. He walks on camera ahead of him again. Still his steps make no sound.

She pulls the rug off the corpse which is not visible and stands looking into the car unable to take her eyes off what she sees while at the same time her hands mechanically begin to fold the rug. The running steps grow louder and Neff comes into the shot breathing hard. Camera stops with him. He stands like that for a moment then turns toward the camera again. There is a look of horror on his face now. He walks on camera ahead of him again. Still his steps make no sound.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The castle window slides open and Rupert hops out. He seals the window and gazes towards the meadows. He opens the trunk of the wagon and leans in. He lifts the quilt off the statue (which is not visible) and stands staring into the wagon, unable to take his eyes off what he spots, while simultaneously his fingers instinctively start to roll the quilt. The galloping hooves grow louder and Luna trots into the scene panting heavily. She joins him. Luna gestures back towards the meadows. She dives into the wagon and starts to haul out the sculpture by the elbows. Rupert calmly reaches past her and removes the helmet from the marble figure's head. She turns to depart. Rupert releases the anchor and shifts the wagon in reverse. Luna is once more busy unraveling the rope from her ankle. The wagon rolls. The wagon, with the lanterns dimmed, reverses, twirls around, and ventures off along the pebble path the way it arrived. They are chatting to each other. Their mouths are seen moving but their dialogue is not audible. They cease talking. Rupert gazes straight ahead. The chariot rides into the scene and halts without veering towards the trail. The wagon door swings open. Luna begins to exit. Luna glances back at him. Rupert leans towards her and wraps her arms around him. Rupert pecks him. In the kiss, she remains motionless. Luna descending. Alarm gong tower and the gate buzzer. The scrolls are still aligned. Luna’s hand retrieves them. Luna steps out from the alcove, sporting the dark blue robe she wore after the banquet, only without a sash. She fastens her coat, glances around the hall, and slides open the hallway gate. Dozens of carriages are stationed now. Marvin, the groom has scrubbed Luna’s carriage and is now buffing the crystal and timber trims. Marvin notices her. He stands tall. He strides along the bridge towards the stable opening. Luna steps out at the crest of the bridge and begins to stroll down the avenue, not too hastily. Camera leads her. She treads about ten or twenty paces. Initially, her footsteps sound sharp and resonant on the cobblestones and echo in the solitary lane. But gradually, as she proceeds, they dissolve into complete hush. She treads a few more paces without noise, then perceives the quiet. She halts abruptly and gazes back. Camera halts with her. She remains like that momentarily, then pivots towards the camera once more. A look of dread is now on her face. She strolls on, camera leading her again. Still, her footsteps produce no noise.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Phyllis steps out, looks toward the tracks, and uncovers a corpse in the car. Despite her shock, she mechanically folds the rug. Neff arrives, dragging the body from the car while Phyllis takes the dead man's hat and then backs the car onto a dirt road. They converse silently as the car moves away. The sedan stops, Neff exits, and Phyllis kisses him, though he's passive. Neff then changes into a suit and walks past parked cars. As he walks down the street, his footsteps, initially distinct, fade into silence. He stops, realizing the silence, and with horror, continues, but his steps remain soundless.
